input_text:
Job Title: Power Planning Engineer

Location: Reading, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Summary

Power Delivery Planning Engineer opportunities with a client located in the Northeastern U.S.. Using Power Flow programs these positions will be responsible for working with internal and external clients on the study, planning and analysis related to power generation and load connections on the clients systems. They offer a competitive salary, great benefits (includes a 401K and Pension plan), a strong work-life balance, generous PTO, holiday pay, growth opportunities, and a strong sense of corporate social responsibility.

location: Reading, Pennsylvania

job type: Permanent

salary: $80,000 - 110,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 4pm

education: Bachelors

Responsibilities

Provide technical support and studies for load connection Propose and justify recommended mitigation projects to any planning criteria identified through the study and analysis Perform studies associated with new load connections and other transmission projects Provide support to Operations when needed (system outages, heavy loading, system analysis etc.) Participate in annual maintenance of department planning, facility connection and other procedure Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

BSEE degree from an ABET accredited institution 3 or more years experience in the use of power system analysis software (Promod, TARA, EMT, or similar software) Demonstrated experience in load connection studies power system analysis Experience in the utility, heavy industrial or similar with power distribution planning and analysis

Qualifications

Experience level: ExperiencedMinimum 3 years of experienceEducation: Bachelors (required)

Skills

Electrical EngineeringPlanningElectrical Engineering

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

At Randstad, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com.

Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility).

Applications accepted on ongoing basis until filled.

Experience Level (if available): None
